title: Talking About Weather
description: Practice speaking about weather conditions and making comparisons.

sentences.tips: 'What's'를 자연스럽게 축약하고, 끝을 올려서 의문문으로 발음하세요.

sentences.text: The temperature is about twenty degrees.
It looks like it's going to rain.
Don't forget to bring an umbrella.
sentences.tips: 'Don't forget'을 한 덩어리로, 'umbrella'의 강세는 두 번째 음절: um-BREL-la.

sentences.text: The forecast says it will be cloudy tomorrow.
sentences.translation: 일기 예보에 따르면 내일 흐릴 거래요.

sentences.text: The weather is perfect for a picnic.
I prefer autumn because the weather is mild.

lines.text: It's sunny but a bit cold.
Yes, the temperature dropped to 15 degrees.
What's the forecast for the weekend?
They say Saturday will be warmer and sunny.

items: Did you pronounce weather vocabulary clearly?
Did you use rising intonation for questions?
Did you stress comparative and superlative forms correctly?
Did you speak at a natural pace?
Did you speak without long pauses?
Did you practice the dialogue smoothly?
Did you use comparatives correctly (hotter, colder)?
Did you use superlatives correctly (the hottest)?
Did you follow the pronunciation tips?
Could a listener understand the weather description?
Did you sound natural when making comparisons?
Did you record and compare all sentences?
